VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Support a Large Number of Products in the Shopping Cart

Level up your storefront's shopping cart capabilities, and deliver exceptional support for buyers that order products in large volumes. With new Cart Scale capabilities, the number of items in a cart can trigger B2B Commerce for Visualforce to asynchronously price the cart and place the corresponding order. Cart Scale also offers an assortment of enhancements for buyers to manage their large carts on the storefront.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Cart Scale includes the following capabilities:

The new Scaled Cart page, which replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0 with buyer experience enhancements for managing a cart that contains a large number of items:
Pagination controls for a more manageable view of all the cart's items.
Options for a buyer to sort and search the cart's items.
Tools for refreshing the price and availability data for the cart's items, which is required before the buyer can check out.
Tools for removing products that become unavailable after a refresh.
Asynchronous processing for pricing items in the cart, including messages and statuses on the Scaled Cart page.
Asynchronous processing for placing an order, including messages, statuses, and new order result email templates.
An option on the My Orders section of the My Account page, Restore Cart, which reopens and reactivates a cart that corresponds to an order that failed to place asynchronously.
Updated sections of the standard Checkout page for reviewing and confirming an order that contains a large number of cart items and that was placed asynchronously.

Define an asynchronous processing threshold, which specifies the number of major line items in the cart that triggers processing to automatically switch to asynchronous:

When the number of major line items is less than the threshold value, cart pricing and order placement execute synchronously.
When the number of major line items equals or exceeds the threshold value, cart pricing and order placement execute asynchronously.

How: After you upgrade the available global data, the new Cart Scale storefront configuration module is available, and includes the following settings:

CONFIGURATION	API NAME	DEFAULT VALUE	USAGE
Enable Cart Scale	cs.enable	FALSE	Enable capabilities for carts that contain a large number of items.
Asynchronous Processing Threshold	cs.asyncthreshold	250	The minimum number of major line items in the cart to switch from synchronous processing to asynchronous processing.

To get started with Cart Scale, change the Enable Cart Scale configuration to TRUE. Be sure to build and activate a new configuration cache.

The new email template for a failed asynchronously placed order, CC Order Async Fail, references two page labels that include placeholder values for links. To ensure that a buyer receives an email that correctly links to your storefront's order pages, edit these page labels to reference your storefront specifically. Complete the steps in Show Order Confirmation Details and Send Order Emails.

NOTE You can continue using the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0, but still take advantage of asynchronous processing for placing an order. For more information, see Optimize Checkout for Large Carts.

To support asynchronous processing for carts, the API includes the following enhancements:

A new global method, ccrz.ccApiCart.priceAsync, executes the logic for pricing a cart and enqueuing the asynchronous Apex jobs. The corresponding logic service provider class, ccrz.ccLogicCartPriceAsync, defines this logic and provides an extension point for modifying or replacing the default behavior.
A new global method, ccrz.ccApiCart.repair, resets the status of a cart when an asynchronous pricing job is unsuccessful. The corresponding logic service provider class, ccrz.ccLogicCartRepair, defines this logic and provides an extension point for modifying or replacing the default behavior.
